Negative

Dream has consistently been at odds with Fundy, with Fundy being one of the few people loyal to L'Manberg throughout nearly its whole history. They fought on opposite sides in the first war, as well as in the Manberg vs Pogtopia War.[304][305] Additionally, their relationship grew very tense during the Exile Conflict. Dream managed to convince Fundy and Tubbo that he supported L'Manberg after Tommy's exile, yet Dream secretly plotted to destroy it after getting Mellohi from Tubbo.[119]

Neutral

Dream and George used to be best friends. They originally started the server together and stuck together for most of their adventures.[80] They fought and stood beside each other during the Early Dream SMP Arc and throughout the L'Manberg Independence War. During the Manberg vs Pogtopia War, Dream made George king of the Dream SMP, which made George very happy.[113] When Tommy burned George's house, Dream jumped to George's defense and made Tubbo exile Tommy as punishment.[306]

Shortly after, Dream told George to step down as king because George was no longer neutral and he kept getting attacked, which Dream wanted to stop from happening. This made George sad, as he felt like Dream hated him. George, along with Sapnap and Quackity, tried to regain kingship with a political protest against Dream's wishes.[307] Later, their conflict was resolved with Dream recognizing El Rapids as independent, with George remaining dethroned. This time, George and Dream left on seemingly neutral-negative terms.[308] Dream expressed to Sapnap and BadBoyHalo during their visits to Pandora's Vault that he would like George to come to visit him as well.[309][310]

While Dream was in prison, George kept having dreams about him. In one of the dreams, George mistook DreamXD for Dream. He said he wanted things to go back to normal and to fix everything.[311] In another dream, he saw that Dream was out of prison and was very happy about it.[312] Quackity also spotted George outside the entrance to the prison, though George never ended up visiting.[313] After Dream escaped prison, George had another dream where Dream became angry at George for not visiting him in prison. In this dream, Dream asked George to help him destroy Kinoko Kingdom. When George refused, Dream killed him. George was very upset by that and destroyed the entire server in the dream in response.[314]

Sometime after Dream took Pandora's Vault as his base, he wrote George's name on a sign in his room in the prison. While he had also written down Sapnap's name below that, George's name was the only name that was fully legible.[315]

Neutral

Dream and Ghostbur were supposedly on good terms, but this was mainly because Dream often took advantage of Ghostbur's trusting nature. While escorting Tommy to his exile location, Dream told Ghostbur that Tommy was just going on vacation. Ghostbur accepted this without a second thought.[316] Later on, Ghostbur was on his way to send out Tommy's beach party invites. Halfway through the invites, Dream took the invites from him with the promise that he would deliver them himself. Dream then told Ghostbur to take a walk in the snow, which resulted in Ghostbur getting lost. Ghostbur was not suspicious of this and continued to see Dream in a positive light.[317]

When Tommy was planning to sneak into Pandora's Vault to kill Dream, Ghostbur was confused and said that he thought they liked Dream. Tommy assured him that they would take only take one of Dream's canon lives in order to send Dream a message that he should not be bad. Upon visiting Dream in the prison, Ghostbur was initially happy to see him, but became upset when Dream threatened to revive Wilbur. Dream ended up killing Ghostbur to revive Wilbur in the hope that Wilbur would help him escape.[318]

In the Afterlife, Ghostbur did not think about Dream specifically, only lamenting that he had messed up his task of helping to kill Dream.[319]

Neutral

Dream and Schlatt had a business relationship, with both parties only working together for their own interest. Very negative

Dream seemed to get along well with Mexican Dream well during Lani's visit, with them teaming up together for a speedrun.[321] Mexican Dream later unsuccessfully tried to get Dream to join Mexican L'Manberg.[322] During Tommy's exile, Dream became more and more hostile towards Mexican Dream. Dream shot an arrow at the image of one of Mexican Dream's friends, but Mexican Dream jumped in front of the arrow, losing a canon life in the process. Shortly afterwards, Dream put up an image of the head of Mexican Dream's friend, causing Mexican Dream to attack him. Mexican Dream lost his final canon life to Dream in the duel that followed.[323]

As a ghost, Mexican Dream expressed his hatred for Dream to Sapnap and George, asking them for Dream's location. Once they arrived at Pandora's Vault, Mexican Dream became infuriated and started planning to break into the prison to kill Dream. He still wanted to kill Dream even after Sapnap told him it was impossible.[324]

Neutral

Niki never had many interactions with Dream. Niki joined L'Manberg upon joining the server, which was on relatively bad terms with Dream's faction.[325] She was part of Pogtopia during the Manberg vs Pogtopia War, putting her and Dream on opposing sides.[326] During the Doomsday War, Dream wanted Technoblade to burn the L'Mantree, but Techno did not know which tree that was. Niki eventually burned the tree, aligning herself against L'Manberg as well.[327]

At the end of the Disc Confrontation, Niki and many others protected Tommy and Tubbo from Dream and helped to imprison Dream.[287] However, Niki and Jack Manifold attempted to kill Tommy sometime after this. Niki briefly considered asking Dream for help with this, but dismissed the idea and stated that she did not like Dream.[328] Niki later participated in the Syndicate's effort to break Dream out of prison. She spawned withers to provide a distraction after the breakout.[329] Niki did not have any issues with this, telling Jack Manifold afterwards that she helped Techno because he was her friend. She also clarified that she had nothing to do with the favor between Techno and Dream.[330] Niki and Dream seem to be on neutral terms since then.

Negative

Dream and Phil were generally distant, mainly interacting when they had mutual goals. Early on, Dream gave Phil a trident in return for an enchanted golden apple.[331] After Tommy's beach party, Phil found out that Dream had not delivered the invites to anyone, which Phil thought was messed up. However, Phil still worked together with Dream during the Doomsday War, helping Technoblade to blow up L'Manberg. Phil said that he only partnered with Dream because they had a common goal and that their partnership was just business.[332]

Later on, Phil helped Techno break Dream out of Pandora's Vault. During the escape, Dream was surprised to see that Phil was helping him.[333] Phil said to Tommy afterwards that this was just business again, and that he was only helping Techno fulfill his favor. Phil was angry that the first thing that Dream did when he got out of prison was tormenting Tommy, and said that he would kill Dream if he saw him again.[334]

A while after Dream's escape, Tommy saw a sign outside Phil's house. On this sign, Dream falsely claimed to have kidnapped Phil right after Tommy had gone to see him. However, Dream was not on the server during this time, so it is unclear how this sign appeared there.[335] Nonetheless, Phil remains on bad terms with Dream due to Dream's behavior towards Tommy.

Negative

Ponk used to be very friendly with Dream, as Dream helped Ponk during the Disc Saga. Their relationship took a turn for the worse when Ponk assisted with the imprisonment of Dream during the Disc Confrontation.[287] Ponk stated he did not directly hate Dream because Dream never stole anything of his. However, he still hated Dream for what he did to others, but not to the extent of Tommy's hatred for Dream.[336] Ponk was angry at Sam when Dream escaped from prison, fearing that Dream would go on to do bad things now that he was out.[337]

Negative

Dream seemed to take a liking to Puffy immediately, following her around for no apparent reason, even without armor. Due to this, Puffy called him her "duckling", and admitted he pulled on her heartstrings.[338] This made Puffy consider joining Dream's side.[339] After the Doomsday War, Puffy was upset that Dream had destroyed everyone's home in L'Manberg, stating that she could no longer support him.[340]

Puffy was one of Dream's main apprehenders during the Disc Confrontation.[287] She was sad that they had to lock up Dream in Pandora's Vault, but felt it was a necessary sacrifice because she thought that Dream went too far in prioritizing Tommy's discs over people's happiness. She planned to visit Dream in prison and hoped that Dream would eventually understand the loneliness that he had put Tommy through in exile. Puffy also hoped that Dream would see that his actions had consequences.[341]

After Tommy's revival, Puffy heard rumors that people were plotting to kill Dream. She did not like this, as she believed that two wrongs did not make a right. She also said that the reason she did not visit Dream in prison was because she did not think he deserved it at that point. Puffy thought that Dream needed to pay for what he did, but realized that being in prison was not enough to stop Dream from affecting people.[342]

Very positive

Punz is Dream's friend and close confidant, and one of his only allies. Dream has Punz's unquestioning and unwavering loyalty, with Punz being on Dream's side no matter what. At first, Punz only fought for Dream because of the payment that he received for his services as a mercenary. He was on Dream's side for many major conflicts, notably the Dream Team SMP vs. L'Manberg War, the Manberg vs Pogtopia War, and Technoblade's execution.[93][343][134]

Following this last event, Punz and Dream admitted that their alliance had grown to a strong friendship. Dream noted that everyone was turning against him and that Punz being on his side would be dangerous for Punz. They agreed that Punz would pretend to be not on Dreams side to prevent Punz from being targeted. Dream left Punz in charge of the Dream SMP, because Dream was going to do something that nobody would like him for and would have to leave soon afterwards.[3]

At some point, Dream trusted Punz with knowledge of the Revival Book. They came to have the same goal of wanting to understand everything about the world. They secretly tested the Revival Book on Vikkstar and LazarBeam for months.[17] Dream and Punz killed themselves and each other multiple times to understand what limbo was like.[37] They wanted to live forever in order to learn everything, realizing that both of them would need to be alive so that they could revive each other.[344]

A while later, Dream and Punz planned to stage the Disc Confrontation. This would make it seem as if Punz had betrayed Dream by getting him imprisoned in Pandora's Vault, so that nobody would ever suspect they had to kill both Dream and Punz to permanently kill them.[345] The day before the Disc Confrontation, Tommy gave Punz many valuables to obtain his help against Dream.[346] Punz pretended to join Tommy's side and led many server members to Dream's location, eventually achieving the goal of getting Dream locked up.[39] In the time after that, Punz kept claiming to others that he had betrayed Dream because Dream had not paid him enough.[347]

After Dream's escape from Pandora's Vault, Punz and Dream secretly met up at a pre-determined rendezvous point. They mentioned that the plan had gone south and that Dream had been in prison for longer than they had planned. Punz provided Dream with a new set of netherite armor and equipment, and the two agreed to meet again later in Punz's tower on Dream's signal.[14]

Dream later told Punz that he had been tortured by Quackity every day for six months. Punz was appalled by this and was sympathetic to Dream. Punz went to Purpled on behalf of Dream to get his help to take revenge on Quackity. However, Punz got very upset when Purpled at first did not believe that Quackity had tortured Dream. He told Purpled that Quackity had done unspeakable things to Dream that went beyond anyone's limit, which eventually made Purpled agree to help Dream. Punz did not reveal his alliance with Dream, telling Purpled that Dream had just paid him a lot to relay a message.[57]

On November 11th, 2022, Tubbo and Tommy took Dream's final life in Pandora's Vault. They went on to tell Punz about this, who was shocked that they had managed to kill Dream by themselves. They asked Punz to join their future nation, and Punz led them to a secret area that he said contained something they could use for their nation. While going down a staircase, Punz became more and more angry and revealed that he had a Revival Book. He said that not everything was about money, immediately adding that he wanted power. Punz went on to revive Dream, and the two chased Tommy and Tubbo up the Power Tower.[200]

Dream and Punz captured Tommy and Tubbo and brought them to Pandora's Vault, where they were put on an obsidian platform surrounded by lava. Dream and Punz explained what their motivations and plans were and that Tubbo and Tommy knew nothing compared to Dream and Punz. They said that they wanted to see what would happen if somebody died a hero, making Tubbo and Tommy choose who would die. Despite this, when Punz and Dream went out of the room, both Tubbo and Tommy managed to escape the prison.[348]

The next day, Tommy came back to the prison to keep Dream and Punz there together. This was so that Tubbo could fire a nuke on them. Punz supported Dream throughout the encounter with Tommy, and did not care when Tommy explained that Dream had almost driven him to kill himself. When Tommy said that Dream just wanted friends, Punz emphasized that he was Dream's friend. Punz was by Dream's side until the nuke ended up killing them all.[349]

Positive

Purpled was Dream's mutual friend, though they did not interact much in the beginning. Dream did fall victim to Purpled's pitfall trap after pushing Purpled into it as well.[88]

A while after Dream escaped from Pandora's Vault, Punz told Purpled that Quackity had tortured Dream every day for months. In the end, this made Purpled agree to kill Quackity together with Dream, with Purpled intending to take control of Las Nevadas. Dream and Purpled confronted Quackity, but they were interrupted by Quackity's army of slimes which attacked them. Dream drew the slimes away from Purpled so that he could chase Quackity. While this led to Purpled losing a canon life, Dream and Purpled did achieve their objective when Quackity lost a canon life as well.[350]

Sworn enemy

Quackity previously had a somewhat neutral relationship with Dream, although they were on different sides in the Manberg vs Pogtopia War.[343] Their relationship deteriorated greatly during and after the Exile Conflict, when Dream gave Tubbo an ultimatum to either exile Tommy or face the consequences. After Tubbo chose to exile Tommy, Quackity was very mad and wanted to kill Dream as soon as possible.[351]

Their relationship became even worse when George was dethroned by Dream in favor of replacing him with Eret. Quackity took George's side and tried to get Dream to reinstate George as king of the Dream SMP.[352] Quackity later destroyed parts of Eret's castle and their throne. This made Dream believe that Quackity's number-one goal was to cause problems on the server, and he declared Quackity to be "the biggest enemy on the SMP". However, after negotiations, Dream agreed to officially recognize Quackity's new country as an independent nation.[353]

In the aftermath of Technoblade's execution, Quackity realized that Dream had assisted Technoblade with his escape. Quackity became convinced that they needed to get rid of Dream since he always interfered with the affairs of L'Manberg. He and the rest of the L'Manberg cabinet planned a festival where they would try to kill Dream.[354] This proved to be unsuccessful and led to Dream destroying L'Manberg in the Doomsday War. During this conflict, Quackity fought on the side of L'Manberg because he said that he was sick of Dream having so much power.[355] A few weeks later, Quackity was among the members of the server who were part of the coalition that rose up against Dream during the Disc Confrontation.[287]

After Tommy was killed by Dream in Pandora's Vault, Sam and Quackity decided to kill Dream as revenge. Sam ended up changing his mind because Dream still had the Revival Book. Quackity agreed with Sam, but told him that Dream needed to be punished at some point. If Sam would not do that, then Quackity said he would.[281] A while after this, Quackity convinced Sam to let him into the prison to torture Dream for the Revival Book's knowledge. Since Dream refused to give this to him, Quackity tortured him every day for months.[356] Quackity admitted to Dream that he liked torturing him and that he did it to remind Dream of every bad thing he had done.[357]

Quackity eventually forced Dream to write a note to Technoblade in which Dream asked him to visit.[163] When Techno visited, Sam trapped him inside Dream's cell.[164] Three months later, Quackity visited them both with the goal to finally obtain the Revival Book from Dream. However, Techno disappeared from the cell while Quackity tried to kill him. Quackity left the cell to search for Techno, but said that he would return to kill Dream.[167] Dream hid underneath the toilet of the cell, where Sam found him. Dream begged Sam to not tell Quackity he was still in the prison. Sam relunctantly agreed, and Quackity was left thinking that Dream had escaped the prison.[168]

Following his escape from Pandora's Vault, Dream encountered Sam locked up in the prison. Dream expressed his hatred for Quackity to Sam, calling Quackity a sociopath with no feelings. He said that he planned to find Quackity and kill him.[358] A while later, Dream also told Foolish that all he wanted was to kill Quackity.[359]

At some time, Punz asked Purpled to help Dream take revenge on Quackity. Purpled agreed and the two of them met Quackity in Las Nevadas. Dream sa
